headline: Butternut Squash Sweet Potato Soup
description: Butternut squash and sweet potatoes combine perfectly in this pureed soup.
name: Butternut Squash Sweet Potato Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into chunks
1 sweet potato, peeled and cut into chunks
2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
4 cups chicken stock, or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Cook and stir butternut squash, sweet potato, carrot, celery, onion, and garlic in hot butter until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Pour chicken stock and sweet bell peppers into butternut squash mixture; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until squash and potato are tender, about 40 minutes.
Pour squash mixture into a blender no more than half full. Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Puree in batches until smooth.
Return pureed soup to pot and season with salt and black pepper.

review.reviewBody: Wow! This recipe is a keeper! I decided I’d make a vegan version. I switched the butter for one heaping tablespoon of coconut oil, the chicken broth for two vegan chicken-like bouillon cubes (Not Chick’n brand) and four cups of water, a half teaspoon of sherry, a pinch of nutmeg, and a half teaspoon of Creole seasoning. I’m certain that it would have been delicious made exactly as directed.

I also rarely comment on recipes but this recipe is so good! The final soup goes just fine without seasoning as the vegetable balance is perfect, but occasionally we add some cinnamon to make the taste it extra cozy. Our family loves it. Thanks!

This has become a go to recipe for me. I chop everything and put it on a baking sheet. I roast everything for about an hour at 450 and then blend with chicken broth. I use what I have on hand. Perfect every time, no matter what combination I use.

Very good! Roasted the butternut, sweet potatoes and sweet peppers (one yellow/one red). Sautéed the onion, celery and garlic in butter then added everything. Added just a bit of salt. Probably would use less butter next time. Lovely combo of flavors. Will make again.
I love this recipe. My only modification is I add about a Tbs of Tumeric and a tap of curry. Deeelish!!

I have been making this type of soup for 2 years. I found that baking the squash and sweet potatoes, then cooling them is the best way to peel them. My additions are 2 Tbsp Cinnamon, 1 Tbsp Nutmeg, 1 cup applesauce. I saute 1 chopped medium onion, 1 clove garlic, celery and 2 cups grated carrots. I doubled the squash. I blend all with a hand immersion blender. Excellent results!
good as is. Will add some milk to make into a potage later, but definitely not necessary.
Absolutely delicious! Going into the favorites file!
This dish was absolutely fabulous! Instead of chicken broth, we used leftover turkey stock from Thanksgiving, so delicious, everyone loved it!
Loved this soup. Very simple for a beginner like me great flavor was on point Next time I want to try 1/4 cup cream just to taste what happens.
Terrific flavor! A different twist that the whole family enjoyed with the inclusion of fresh peppers. Served with a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds. YUM!
I added bacon bits, 1/4 c and 1/2 lb ground turkey cooked with 1/4 c onion and 2 sm cloves garlic. Delicious!
Very easy and tasty. Added some fresh rosemary for the simmering part, which gave a nice flavor.
I used three small sweet potatoes and a few handfuls of baby carrots. Added ginger, coriander, turmeric, and a little cayenne and honey
It was delicious, and it gave me a chance to use my new imertion stick blender!
Made it to store for lunches. Didn’t add the red pepper and added a tsp of curry powder. Yum

I put together this recipe with a few others to match the ingred I had at home. I wish one of the recipes had mentioned how hard it is to cut and peel the butternut squash. I ended up microwaving it to soften it up. 10 min for parts of it! It definitely made things much easier.
Hands down my favorite recipe! absolutely delicious and very forgiving. I forgot to add carrots and instead added apples. super yummy!
Wonderful soup! I used some coconut oil along with the butter, dried onion rather than fresh, and only one cloves of garlic. Perfect medicine for the cold bones I have from outdoor activities today!
Did not have celery. Turned out well. Will add to the autumn rotation
Good! I added 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, 3 carrots, 2 celery , 3 tsp minced ginger and 1/2 tsp turmeric
LOVED this soup. Had a small squash so used 2 sweet potatoes and it was delish! will make again and again
Absolutely AH-MAZING! I added 2 peeled royal gala apples to add a little sweetness to it and it was perfection. This soup will definitely be a staple in our home during the colder months.

I have made this soup four times! I do not change a thing. It is sweet, thick and nutritious. This is the best butternut squash soup I have eaten and I’ve had many! I eat a bowl with some bread and it’s very filling. That’s all I need for a quick lunch or dinner. Sometimes I double the recipe and freeze half. I take out a bowl the night before and let it defrost. Be aware that thawing in the refrigerator takes quite along time. Pop it into the microwave for a quick eat and serve. Love this!

This soup is amazing. It’s fun to make with the kids and it’s delicious. I roasted the vegetables in the butter for longer than indicated and tried to get many of them brown before moving on to the next step.

Made this from leftover roasted sweet potatoes and squash (from Thanksgiving) using turkey stock. It is spectacular. Following the advice of several commenters, I added ginger, turmeric and curry powder. I also added a splash of dry sherry. It’s great!
Really delicious and perfect as is. Thought it would have cream or half n hall but didn't need it. I think it will be perfect for Thanksgiving. Nice change!

We loved it but we ended up adding to it a bit. We added extra carrots, celery, sweet peppers and garlic. We also put Rosemary, Basil, Thyme, Nutmeg and Turmeric in it. With all the additions my family loved it and I will definitely be making it again.

This was great!! I didn’t have celery, and scaled the quantities up to feed my large (hungry) family. Roasted all veggies in oven first — diced about 3 sweet potatoes, 2 peppers (red and yellow), one onion, 5 carrots, and butternut squash. Placed all on baking sheets lined with foil, brushed with olive oil, roasted in 400 degree oven for about 30 minutes. Browned garlic in melted butter, added the roasted veggies, 1.5 boxes of vegetable stock. Simmered for about 30 mins, seasoned with a few shakes of cayenne pepper. When everything nice and tender, used a submersible wand blender to purée. WOW was this yummy!! My family dubbed it a keeper, and I agree! Was great with the cayenne kick.
We loved this soup. I also added a little curry powder and a bit of maple syrup.
Healthy, tasty and surprisingly easy! I make this soup regularly! I do add creole seasoning now and then, to spice it up just little.
I oven-roasted all the vegetables, and otherwise made it exactly as directed. It was wonderful, and made a large amount. Something about the sweet peppers gives it a unique flavor.
Yum yum yum. Delicious recipe. I added some nutmeg, curry and red pepper flakes for a little extra zing. When it was all done I served it with a bit of sour cream. Will make this again!

Just made, very easy and my family loves it, including my 19 year old picky eater! The only thing I did different was throw in an extra carrot and I also used green peppers but only 2. I also added some nutmeg, ginger and a dash of smoked paprika to salute my Hungarian Mother in Law. Make sure you let it cool before you throw it in the nutri-bullet!!

I made this soup very close to the recipe except I left out the celery and added some fresh ginger. I also roasted my vegetables first after reading another review. I really love the roasted taste. It was really delicious! I will be making it again for sure!
a wonderful and filling soup. I added 2 fresh sweet potatoes, kosher salt, 1 tsp. curry powder and 1/2 tsp. ginger. Mmmm, good! A keeper recipe. Thanks for sharing!
Delicious... Maybe a bit too much sweet red pepper taste, but otherwise, absolutely delicious.
Loved it. Can't wait to have it again

Great soup! I cooked the initial vegetables in olive oil instead of butter this time because we have a dairy free lunch guest, and I added a touch of Chipotle Chili Powder (probably between 1/2 teaspoon and 1 teaspoon) to give it a little light heat. Great way to change the dish up and make it a little more flavorful! Definitely doesn't need cream or anything like that because the texture is great on its own. Definitely going to make it again.
What a great recipe! I added a tsp of red chili pepper flakes to spice it up.
i will make it again but add apples its not sweet enough, very plain .made it with veggie broth instead of chicken broth due to the vegetarian in our family.

This is so good! I did make a few changes to use what I had on hand. I had bacon fat in the fridge so I used that instead of butter. I did not have quite enough butternut squash, so in went an extra carrot. Finally, I added a scant tablespoon of cumin just for the fun of it. I will certainly make this soup again.
Add a touch of nutmeg and a small amount of chile powder too to give it a little kick. FIVE STARS
Very easy and delicious recipe to follow. The only thing I did was add a couple jalapeños to give it a little spice.

Great soup! Sweet and smooth. Added an extra carrot and an extra celery stick. Could use a bit more flavour/spice. Lots of cracked pepper is great to keep it simple, or some cayenne as well. A bit of ginger might also be a nice addition, I'll try that next time.

Loved it. Used a large butternut, large sw potato, 1/2 red pepper, med orange pepper, 2 large garlic, 2 tsp salt, about 1/4 tsp pepper (3 shakes); added 1 c milk...is very thick and used veg broth ( 3 c Knorr & 1 c Harvest Sun), instead of chicken.

This soup has become my new all time fall favourite. 
Simple to make, superb taste!
I made this exactly as the recipe called for and we loved it. Thick, creamy and wonderfully seasoned with the veggies and garlic.
This soup came out very well. It was tasty, but personally I found the taste of three peppers overwhelmed everything else. Next time I will only use one.
Delicious, flavorful and easy to make. I used my stick blender and only had to clean one pot! Very creamy and will make instead of straight boring butternut squash soup!
Delicious, flavorful and easy to make. I used my stick blender and only had to clean one pot! Very creamy and will make instead of straight boring butternut squash soup!

Only change I made was to add 1 tablespoon of lemon juice (to taste) this really kicks up the flavor of this soup. I like this soup better than the more popular butternut squash soup as it doesn't have cream cheese.
Amazing hearty soup that is so creamy minus the cream. I like roasting the veggies in the oven instead of cooking on the stove top. I am making it again tonight.

I would definitely make this again, but would omit the celery. I'm not a fan of celery. The texture was wonderful. Smooth and not too thick without adding cream or milk. I didn't change anything and followed the directions exactly. I do think it needs a little zing...it's a bit on the bland side...and, again, I think the celery overpowered the other flavors. Besides omitting the celery next time, I might add a little cheyenne pepper. Very good recipe.
The best soup ever! So naturally creamy - and with just the right amount savory balanced with sweetness. I will make it again and again. Can't wait to serve for Thanksgiving!

I had never cooked with butternut squash before and this recipe made it super easy! I used a yam instead of a sweet potatoe and I added a package of firm tofu before I blended the soup for a little added protein, I also added a little nutmeg. This soup will become a regular fall meal for us for sure,
This was good, but we have had better soups. I made it as it said, but it was a bit sweet for our taste buds. It wasn't terrible mind you just not what we were looking for.
This was good, but we have had better soups. I made it as it said, but it was a bit sweet for our taste buds. It wasn't terrible mind you just not what we were looking for.
This was easy, delicious and definitely a keeper!
Yummy!! No bell peppers on hand and went with curry seasoning. Making it again this weekend and will roast the squash, sweets, and carrots.
I used veg stock instead of chicken and yellow, red, and green peppers. Taste excellent.
delicious base but I added some cream cheese, cinnamon, and a touch of agave nectar

This was too thick for my taste so I thinned it with coconut milk. I also added minced ginger and half a minced jalapeño to the vegetables when I roasted them. Added a little curry powder to the seasonings. Basicly though, a good and healthy recipe.
Thanks !! it was really good

I made his recipe for my soup group at school and my colleagues LOVED it! I was amazed at how hearty and creamy it seems without any dairy in it! I made it the second time without using any butter (to make it even healthier) and it was just as delicious.
Made this for dinner. I added additional spices. Smoky paprika,cinnamon & cayenne pepper to taste. I added chopped walnuts on top of each bowl for a little crunch. It was enjoyed by all!

I have to say this is one of the most favourful soups I have made. I did add a little curry (1 tsp.) and 1/2 tsp. of ginger because I like a little bit of spice. It was very thick so I added just a 1/2 a cup of coconut milk and it was a lovely consistancy and taste. I will definitely making this soup on a regular bases.

This was surprisingly easy to prepare and delicious. Delicious soup. It is smooth and hearty. No need for cream, it's already velvety. I didn't have carrots or celery so I just added more sweet peppers and celery seed, coriander and ginger. 

It was an awesome side for brats for a nice cozy dinner at home. You could add smoked sausage to it for a heartier soup meal for the guys like mine who want meat with dinner. Mine likes it on the side, so I used fresh sausages and grilled them.

I just made this recipe and wanted to say it was very good. I like a bit of spice so I added red chili flakes and a bit of fresh ginger and curry powder. Also I substituted the butter with olive oil. The soup was delightful. It was the first squash soup I have ever made and I will make it again.

This was amazing. I admit that I had doubts but this was super creamy (without the cream) and super sweet. I roasted the squash and sweet potatoes and steamed the carrots (I should have roasted them too). Going back for seconds ...
Amazing, I skipped the blender and left it chunky. So delicious and satisfying. Taste the natural sweetness of the veggies. I even ate it at room temp. Delicious.

I have used allrecipes for years and this is my first review. This is a unique, flavorful and wonderful soup! I didn't even have to use salt and pepper because the combination of vegetables were great on their own. I made this soup with butternut because that is what I had on hand but I am sure it would be just as tasty with acorn squash as that is one of my two fave squashes. I used two good sized bell peppers; one yellow and one red. It is not your typical squash soup. It is more savory than sweet. It is so good I will be bringing it to our Thanksgiving family get together.
It was a nice twist on the classic butternut squash soup.
Fantastic! I used Red Palm oil in place of butter and it was delicious.
Best recipe I've ever made from here!

I've prepared many recipes from Allrecipes, but I've never felt the need to comment until now. This was a really good soup! I made it as written with the exception of the celery (we didn't have any.) I thought I might have to add cream or milk, or additional seasoning, but it was fine as is. This will be an autumn staple for us!
I oven roasted the squash, sweet potatoes, carrots, onions and garlic prior to adding it to the broth.
This has become a favorite in our home!
